meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be collected.
meanings.sent1: The collectability of stamps makes them popular among hobbyists.
meanings.sent2: The collectability of coins can vary depending on their rarity.
meanings.sent3: The collectability of seashells led to a competition among beachcombers.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for collecting vintage toys highlighted the collectability of such items.
meanings.sent5: The collectability of baseball cards can be a profitable investment for some.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of an item being sought after by collectors.
meanings.sent1: The collectability of limited edition sneakers drives up their prices.
meanings.sent2: The collectability of antique furniture often depends on its condition.
meanings.sent3: The collectability of old comic books sometimes surprises even the most dedicated collectors.
meanings.sent4: The collectability of rare artwork can turn a simple painting into a valuable treasure.
meanings.sent5: The collectability of certain coins can create a competitive bidding war at auctions.
